subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to identify a JavaCore failure ?
msgSnippet: ... JavaCore is a library that produces a coredump if an exception is not caught. I know the JVM is not terminated in that case, but I don t know what happens
messageBody:
Shinobu Kawai wrote:

>Hi Joby,
>
>
>>1) Where my testcase is creating a JavaCore but the
>>testcase is passing. Is there a way I can handle that
>>situation ?. I want to make that testcase fail.
>>
>>
>I don't know what a "JavaCore" is, but is the test handling "JavaCore"
>as you expected it to be handled? If so, I would say "JavaCore" is fine,
>and leave it alone. And of course, if you want to make a test fail no
>matter what, use fail().
> http://www.junit.org/junit/javadoc/3.8.1/junit/framework/Assert.html#fail(java.lang.String)
>
>
JavaCore is a library that produces a coredump if an exception is not
caught. I know the JVM is not terminated in that case, but I don't know
what happens then (I've never used it). You should check the
documentation of JavaCore.

--
Mark Van Peteghem
http://www.q-mentum.com -- easier and more powerful unit testing
